case_vignette: an 9-month-old infant is brought to the physician because of a generalized nonpruritic rash for 2 days. the rash began on her trunk and spread to her extremities. five days ago, she was taken to the emergency department for fever of 40.5°c (104.9°f) and a 1-minute generalized tonic-clonic seizure. she was born at term and has no history of serious illness. her immunizations are up-to-date. current medications include acetaminophen. her temperature is 37.2°c (99.0°f) and pulse is 120/min. examination shows a maculopapular rash that blanches on pressure. a photograph of the rash is shown. posterior auricular lymphadenopathy is present.
question: which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a generalized rash that started on my trunk and spread to my extremities, and I recently had a high fever and a brief shaking episode.
How old are you?
I am 9 months old.
Does your rash look like small red spots or blisters?
My rash looks like small red spots.
Have you been vaccinated for measles, mumps, and rubella (MMR)?
Yes, my immunizations are up-to-date.
Does anyone in your family or immediate surrounding have similar symptoms, or has anyone been diagnosed with a contagious disease recently?
No, there is no history of similar symptoms or a diagnosed contagious disease in my family or immediate surroundings recently.
Has the fever resolved, or are you still experiencing high temperatures?
The fever has resolved; my current temperature is 37.2°C (99.0°F).
Final Diagnosis: Roseola (Sixth Disease)
